conclusion: The rod MN moves with instantaneous speed v on the left side of the fixed partition.
Only the left rectangle ABNM changes its area, the right rectangle MNCD is never cut by the rod and no current flows through the right-hand resistor.
Induced e.m.f. in the left-hand loop is E = BLv.
Current in the left-hand loop is I = BLv/R.
The field B is perpendicular to the rod and directed into the page.
The current along the rod is from top to bottom for v < 0.
The magnitude of the Ampère force on the rod is F = B^2L^2/R * v.
The force is always opposite to the velocity, removing mechanical energy from the system.
At the initial moment, the spring is at its natural length.
Mechanical energy at the initial moment is E_mech = 1/2 * m * v_0^2.
At the first right-hand turning point, speed v = 0 and the spring returns to its natural length.
Mechanical energy is zero at the first right-hand turning point.
All initial kinetic energy is converted into Joule heating in the resistor.
The heat developed in the resistor is Q.
From energy conservation, 1/2 * m * v_0^2 = Q, leading to v_0 = sqrt(2Q/m).
The magnitude of the Ampère force at the initial instant is F_initial = B^2L^2/R * sqrt(2Q/m).
The force depends only on the given quantities B, L, R, m, and the measured heat Q, independent of the spring constant.
